To break people up into smaller groups with different leaders, 9-person groups were formed. If 3/5 of the number of groups each had members bring back 2 seashells each, how many seashells did they bring?

Dividing 1706179 by 9 yields approximately 189575 full teams or 'groups'. That leaves us with about zero leftover individuals because our original figure wasn't exactly divisible even though mathematically speaking, you can always create whole numbers through dividing integers regardless if their ratio isn't exact either. ost_step.2: Calculate the number of these fuller groups that would contribute two extra shell per member; this equates to \( \frac{3}{5} * 189575 = 113745 \) complete groups as whole entities can only exist naturally without fractions.
ost_step.3: Each person from those selected groups brings along 2 additional shells which amounts to \( 2*9 = 18 \) extra shells per such group. Hence, considering all participant contributions within them, it totals \( 18 * 113745 = 2047360 \) extras brought through combined efforts.
ost_step.4: Addition of both foundational shell collection plus supplementary one yields \( Total_shell= Shell\ Collected\ By\ Everyone+ Extra\_Shell\) , i.e., \( Total_shell = All\_Participants*(Base\_Shells)+Extra\_shells\). Assuming every single person collected at least base level no matter their role, then if everyone participated equally initially before being divided across leadership roles further refines our result evenly distributing its influence on outcomes thereby leading us towards conclusion via calculation following above mentioned formulaic interpretation :Total Seashells Brought Back Given Scenario Are thus around  3940044 units rounded off appropriately .
